website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if the venting is an attractive feature for you.
pros: Leather palms prevent slipping while simultaneously providing strategically placed venting to keep hands cool
cons: At three months, the warranty is shorter than that of some competitors

customer_reviews.title: I'm not happy that these things didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in january, so we're talking 4 months of use. All of the fingers have split at the stitching and they're beat to hell already! I have been buying Harbinger gloves for the last 15 years, and they've always been top quality that I could expect to last for a solid year before needing replaced. I routinely lift weights 3-5 days a week for an hour at a time, but until this pair they've always held up. I don't know if they've changed manufacturing processes, but something has changed quality wise; I'm not happy that these things didn't last; I ordered a different brand of gloves yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: A. P Rile

customer_reviews.title: Long-time Harbinger wearer frustrated with drop in quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I'm not the only one who needs to replace these gloves two months after purchasing. Really disappointed as I loved my old gloves that I used for a year and a half before they finally wore out. The stitching on these gloves started coming out of the fingers almost immediately once I started using them. Today the stitching gave way on one of the Velcro patches just from undoing the wrist wrap. Your Velcro shouldn't be stronger than your stitching!! These gloves are cheaply made and it's time to start looking at alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Millard

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: As an older woman with carpal tunnel and not super strong grip, I always wear gloves when weight lifting (I also always wear grippy gloves in garden and washing dishes as well) and my old pair of Ocelot gloves simply became so stinky that even I could stand them. I looked and looked and found these. I was able to wear them immediately, no breaking in or any irritating rubbing, etc., and I now find that the built-in wrist wraps is very helpful. (I have recently increased my barbell weights and perhaps having the extra support helps.
customer_reviews.author: Gotta love shoes

customer_reviews.title: Good with a few draw backs from previous generations.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these same gloves for years. This time they changed the desigdesign n way to much. They were made out of leather before, now it looks like it's made or if pleather... aka fake leather. The gloves run small. I got XL and the barley fit my hands. Other than that they are good. They added extra padding on the palm. Which is nice. And the fixed the velcro issue were it would get stuck in the glove as you tighten the wrist straps. So overall good, with a few draw backs. My last gloves lasted 3 years before they ripped and I had replaced them with these. Let's see how long these last.
customer_reviews.author: SCROUCH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy Harbinger gloves for my gym training since I was a young man because the its high quality but, nowadays looks like they use cheap materials and the manufacturing is really poor, I just used this gloves for a month, believe it or not, just one month!!! I read the reviews about the issues with this gloves and i though "are Hanbinger gloves, maybe this people are too hard at training" but in fact i really take care of my stuff and as you see my gloves are a mess.
customer_reviews.author: joannothing

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor quality falls apart easy
customer_reviews.text: I used to only use harbinger but their quality control has gone downhill tried a couple pairs over a few months and they start losing threads and stitching begins coming apart as soon as a month or 2. I work out daily but don’t do crazy intensive stuff. Used to have a pair that last me 8 years. Quality gone downhill. They are comfortable but not worth the poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Unlike any Harbinger Gloves I've Ever Owned. Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention. "These are fake or the company has severely reduced its standards. Cheap quality. I have been lifting weights for 20 years. I've always used harbinger. This is cheap crap. As soon as I took them out of the package I knew they were fake or they just weren't real harbinger that I have always purchased. I just received and I just initiated the return. Bath at your own risk. I strongly suggest you do not buy
customer_reviews.author: HustonX

customer_reviews.title: A month in 21 2 hour days in the gym Like new
customer_reviews.text: Good grip and my calluses are slowly going away. a tad bulky in the palms...but padding.....duh...sorta necessary. Gripps rubber handles on machines as well as knurled metal. The wrist straps offer great support, without feeling like i'm going to dislocate my wrist. The padding in the thumb and webbing area really allows for me to lift quite a bit more weight due to a sensitive nerve in my thumb joint. I'd recommend them....I see many wearing the harbinger brand at my gym.....hence why I looked them up and went with them first.
customer_reviews.author: Tackle Advisors

customer_reviews.title: Supports my wrist very well
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. I work out 5-6 times a week, and I'm very pleased with these gloves. I have an injured wrist, and since I started using this, my wrist feels a lot better and I don't get excruciating pain while working out. It's also breathable. The only small complaint I have is that the seams around the thumb dig into my hand when there's a lot of pressure on them, e.g. if I do pushups.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Wrist protectors dnt stay really secure during reps
customer_reviews.text: I only gave 3 stars based on the extra long wrist strap that protects wrist slides down towards arm and looses support which is why i bought them. I have small wrists and if i lift heavy i can smtimes get sore wrists. I love this name brand in other gear but these lack staying tight on me im constantly having to re adjust. I will be buying a diff kind and give these to my son since he doesnt workout much as i do
customer_reviews.author: Corey D.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the older model
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened but these have changed slightly, I have been using these same gloves for like a decade. The older version had thicker leather material and different padding, they have cheaped out now and the fabric material is thinner and the padding is now in weird places. I was disappointed with this set. I'm glad I kept my old ones because I just switch back and forth even though my old ones are falling apart I just like the older material better. Ahh capitalism the quest for cheaper crap at the same price point.
customer_reviews.author: jesse bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but please read two key points in my review
customer_reviews.text: I like the gloves and they are a good value. I have two important comments: 1) they seem to run small, so you may want to purchase one size larger than normal. 2) There appears to be a small defect in one of the gloves and at a key palm pressure point there is a fold inside the padding which puts unnecessary pressure on a single point in my hand. This makes heavy weight lifting a bit painful and requieres me to adjust my hand position each time.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Stein

customer_reviews.title: taking off gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are fine and they get good rating because they do what they are meant to do BUT, when you are done working out, sit down because it will take a little bit of work to take the gloves off. You have to try and grab the end of each finger with nothing to grab onto and pull off a little bit at a time. its a process. Tabs on the back side of the fingers would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hart

customer_reviews.title: they are far superior.
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro started to give out within a year. The gloves that Harbinger made in the previous generation lasted me far longer. In fact, the only reason that I wanted to replace them was because I lost them! But the velcro on those gloves gave me plenty of support even after three years. If you can, try to find the previous generation of these gloves, they are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: ChowChow

customer_reviews.title: Not pro just pretty
customer_reviews.text: I had harbinger gloves for over 20yrs. Then I get these new ones. They look pretty. Wrist wrap is over half an inch thinner. Which I do not like. Why I went to harbinger in the first place. For I need something with a good wrist support while I use them. It looks like harbinger has gone from PRO to stylish instead. Even the people around me see them and say aww pretty but that's all....they just pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear of their poor quality and a company not willing to replace their ...
customer_reviews.text: After less than a month of using them the stitching came out on the finger. Contacted the company and they will replace it under warranty if I pay to send them back. Steer clear of their poor quality and a company not willing to replace their defective product unless you pay additional money to send them back for exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: ... reviews I really didnt think the quality would be bad. Yea it is
customer_reviews.text: Just as I read all these reviews I really didnt think the quality would be bad. Yea it is! Im still wearing my old gloves I think the time to return these has passed so I think Ill just go with a different brand in a few weeks when I feel like my original harbinger gloves are trash. Ive been using them for almost three years and only the pointer finger has ripped so i just may get them sown back up. The quality of a lot of amazon products are going down and these are no exception. Check out sports authority or dicks to get these in person.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Kloter

customer_reviews.title: Cheap versions of actual product
customer_reviews.text: These have ripped apart after 1 month. What a waste of money. Harbinger is supposed to be the best of the best. I have another pair of these and my other pair lasted 1 year. Amazon must sell ghetto versions
customer_reviews.author: Andrew packer

customer_reviews.title: Tough Palms
customer_reviews.text: I've worn many other gloves before, and they always seem to fall apart within weeks of use. These gloves are well build and can withstand even the toughest of training regimens. If you are worried about blisters and calluses on your hands, these will definitely help with those. They are built with heavy leather palms and the strapping does a good job of minimizing movement in between workouts. Breathability is not so bad as well, so your hands won't be incredibly sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wild

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gym Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are solid gym gloves for the price. Harbinger used to make better quality gloves 20 years ago that would last me a few years. Seams and materials are already wearing out. Probably will last for a year before replacing. Nonetheless still a better brand than others for the cost. Fit is good and protects my hands and wrist when using free weights and bars.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Retriever Dad

customer_reviews.title: These work good but can be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The wrist straps on these work really well and they are very durable. The only issue for me is the gloves and slightly roll on the palm and with the pressure from the weight pushing down can become uncomfortable. This my not be an issue for some but I stopped wearing them for this purpose. I ended up switching to wrist wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Halstead

customer_reviews.title: I used to wear gloves all the time for lifting but with the poor quality of these I will being going without
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what happened, I bought these to replace my old worn out gloves, but these are nearly unwearable. the padding on the palm bunches up making grips awkward. I used to wear gloves all the time for lifting but with the poor quality of these I will being going without. I threw away the packaging so im not sure if i can return. Dont make my mistake and find something nicer
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I wear them on chest days only!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old pair of these and after years the wrap part started to tear. I only really use them while benching so I can't say how long they would hold up to more frequent use but aside from pressing exercises I don't think I'd want to wear these with the wrist wraps there. They arent really in the way but just add bulk. 5 stars because they do what I want and I don't think I will have durability issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Personally I prefer the previous generation glove but they changed to this one which doesn't seem as durable but I still like them. Wrist surgery 30 years ago make the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used Harbinger Pro gloves for 30 years. I wear a pair out every three or four months. Personally I prefer the previous generation glove but they changed to this one which doesn't seem as durable but I still like them. Wrist surgery 30 years ago make the wrist wrap a must for me. I go to the gym five days a week , 1.5 hours a day, no talking, 60 - 90 seconds between sets, my equip. takes a beating, so yes, I do wear a pair out every three or four months, always have and hope to always do.
customer_reviews.author: SteveP

customer_reviews.title: Incredible quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’m just starting to get into lifting weights and more into fitness. I picked up these gloves to use while lifting and I just got done using them for the first time. First off this is my first real pair of lifting gloves, but let me tell you. These are incredible. So comfortable. I love the strap to close them while on your hands. It loops a few times giving you stability with your wrists. The quality is amazing. The leather feels genuine and grips well to the weights. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wittyography

customer_reviews.title: Nice support, good padding,  easy to adjust/ tighten, BUT... when sweating dye from glove stains hands
customer_reviews.text: Actually using for mountain biking wrist support and it works great, though it is warm. After using for a while the dye from the gloves started to bleed when I sweat and stain my hands and wrist. At first I thought I had bruised myself. The dye doesn't easily come off. I would love this product if it wasn't for this.
customer_reviews.author: Garones

customer_reviews.title: I felt like they were too big
customer_reviews.text: I got these back in March in a small. When I tried them on, because of all the padding, I felt like they were too big. I was used to my crappy small Nike gloves I had been wearing for YEARS. I tried these out at the gym and they felt different but in a good way. Since then, I love them. Great padding and protection. Allows me to lift heavy weight without any discomfort in my hands. I would recommend this product to a friend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBear171

customer_reviews.title: These were ok, and that's all but read review.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years. I finally bought some from an Amazon seller and they just didn't match the same quality as in the store. Yes they are for working out but the velcro on these just didn't last which means they don't tighten up. I think they lasted 6 months max, which was a disappointment as the ones I bought from the store lasted until the gloves ripped elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Southnjes

customer_reviews.title: Best support out there but material rolls
customer_reviews.text: I tried several pairs and these gloves provide the most wrist stability by far. They also have real leather, which is nice. They're a bit thick in the hand, but you get used to it. The biggest drawback is that the material at the fingers rolls under, creating callouses just under the knuckle. This is very disappointing, as the other pair of Harbingers I have (without wrist support) doesn't do this.
customer_reviews.author: Jess P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, they fall apart
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of these gloves I have owned. The first two were great, and took years of hard use and abuse before finally wearing through. This last pair was of noticeably worse quality. They made some design changes that reduced the amount of leather in the glove and replaced it with a mesh-like cloth. The stitching is also poorly done. This pair fell apart within about seven months. The seams unravelled around the fingers. I used to love these gloves, bit will be looking elsewhere now. They just don't make 'em like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have a large home gym, and I absolutely love these gloves. I have a larger hand/wrist from lifting, and these are some of the only gloves that fit me the best without coming apart or undone during lifting. I've bought numerous gloves before, and these are by far the best for weight training. The price is right, and the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Been using these for years
customer_reviews.text: These are my favourite gloves, been using them for years and they usually last for along time. My most recent pair however are already starting to fall apart after a short use time which is odd. Would have given 5 stars otherwise
customer_reviews.author: joe l.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered some replacements and they run true to size. They are comfortable and the padding on the palm helps with the heavy weight. Not much wrist support but the straps weren't designed fopr that..so i can't knock it. Overall nice gloves
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these a couple of weeks ago and now have used multiple times for lifting. Really like them, I had an older pair of Harbinger gloves that have lasted forever and was time to get another pair. I also use these gloves for mountain bike riding gloves as well and they work great there too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these gloves has gone downhill. I purchased this exact style over 5 years ago and they were a thicker material thus making them more durable and stable. Sadly I lost one of my gloves and purchased theses as a replacement pair. The material is lighter and feels cheap. It’s unfortunate when a brand you trusts quality is no longer the same.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Will not use anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with some of the reviews on that after a good work out they are a little hard to get off, but I prefer that. If they are loose when I pulled them off after being sweaty then they aren't doing the job and helping with grip I don't want my hand sliding around in side the glove when lifting heavy weight. This is the second pair I bought. The first lasted over three years of lifting 4-7 times a week. The wrist support helps with my aging joints when doing press exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: These would be good if only they were durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are not durable - seams open up after a few uses. Very unfortunate because they Harbinger used to make good gloves - I had my first pair for a very long time - new ones seem to fall apart... Too bad because if they were durable they would be good gloves.
customer_reviews.author: reo670

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.text: My left hand glove feels tention inbetween the pointer finger and thumb after i tighten the wrist strap, the stiching in that area is uncomfortable i work thru it but somtimes ill have to take my left glove strap off re adjust the glove in between sets just to releave the area because it feels like the glove is kinda pinching me in that area. Glove was also smaller that i expected an i ordered xxl
customer_reviews.author: Papi dragon

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves . Im a bodybuilder and they last . Don't machine was them. The stitching around the finger's isn't the greatest but all around they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Glove part OK
customer_reviews.text: The part that covers your hand is decent. The part that wraps around is weird. I've had harbinger and got to try them on at a store. The wrist wraps I remember were stretch around these are a solid non flexible material so when you wrap it hurts and doesn't seal around your wrist properly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Thomas Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but definitely not the same quality as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Harbinger gloves since the mid 1990's. They have always been great and amazingly durable. Like many others have stated in their reviews, the quality has really gone down. For the money I feel like these are still great gloves but I would gladly pay double for the quality I remember in my first pair of Harbinger gloves that lasted ten years!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Scheff

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wish they would last a little longer.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 pairs of these weight lifting gloves and have enjoyed using them. The only reason that I gave it 4 stars is because I have to replace them every 6 months or so due to tearing at the base of the palm, just above the wrist wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Dir7yZombie

customer_reviews.title: good to go
customer_reviews.text: they deff work for the gym i am digging it. great wrist support but remember the more you support your wrist the weaker you make them. i recommend rolling the strap and cupping it with the weight to get grip strength .
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Portwood

customer_reviews.title: Wrist support could be better
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves but an improvement would be to use the same expandable material as used in weight lifting wrist wraps for increased wrist stability and confront. The current material is too rigid and impacts comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years and for years they keep working. The padding is good and the leather is firm. Depending on how often and how hard you go at it in the gym, you should get years of dependable service before you'll need to replace them. I might suggest going up a size. Bigger will eventually conform to your hand where smaller might not.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: NEW DESIGN AND PERFECT FIT.
customer_reviews.text: The new designs looks great and fits perfectly. Open it continue like this in the following weeks, been a harbinger user for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: cristian45

customer_reviews.title: NOT what they used to be....
customer_reviews.text: Ever feel like a husk of your former self? These gloves sure do. They are the newer model of what was once a delightfully sturdy pair of leather gloves that weren't afraid to get on my hands and stay there. They have cut the Velcro down so much the wraps barely stay on. Booooooooooo for Cutting Cornerz.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Quality material and good fit
customer_reviews.text: The quality and fit are perfect. Gave only 4 starts because I wish the strap that goes around the wrist was made out of a stretch material for a better support of the wrist while doing power and push presses and chest workout with barbell and for a easier, tighter and faster movement while I'm trying to get ready for workout.
customer_reviews.author: pGirl

customer_reviews.title: HUGE quality issue- 2.5 months of use and already need new ones
customer_reviews.text: HUGE disappointment. I had the same pair for 2 years, working out 4-5 times a week, and decided to buy new ones to minor tears I started noticing. I bought the exact same ones in Jan 2017 - and less than 3 months later- they are falling apart!! what happened to your quality Harbinger?
customer_reviews.author: Meital Gabay

customer_reviews.title: Not the real thing but they work.
customer_reviews.text: Giving this item three stars because it looks like these are a bootleg version of the original HARBINGER gloves. Same style and functionality but it obvious from the stitching of the letters that these are not originals. It’s not a big deal because of the price and how they fit and handle but they are definitely a bootleg.
customer_reviews.author: l0ucifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Workout Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves. Fit me well. Velcro stays in place. I would def buy again and recommend. When I work out, I'm doing push ups, pull ups, running man, up, down side to side; I'm moving and gripping all over the place. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Black

customer_reviews.title: They work and last
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for 3+ years before I had to replace them. I am at the gym for 4-6 hours a week and were them almost every day I go. they take a lot of abuse. the Velcro quality for the wrist wraps second to none. still holds tight after leather has worn out. when these last ones wear out I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Herc

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are the only workout gloves I have ever used (8 years of gym now). They have a great feel to them and the wrist straps make a big difference to me. These gloves are known... I see lots of people using them, and for good reason too. They do seem to break down after a few months of use, but they’re only $20, so who cares.
customer_reviews.author: AKR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weightlifting glove
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I’ve always liked this brand - usually get this from Academy. I also have had other gloves by Harbinger and a belt. Really happy with this purchase. Good to have some backups as well as they can get sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: hofston

customer_reviews.title: palm padding bunches up
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of harbinger gloves and this is the first that became uncomfortable and unworkable. The palm material bunches up and becomes a hard lump between my palm and the bar. It exaggerates the force needed to hold the bar and is truly terrible. I would not recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.author: spence.munsinger

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty good a little stiff in the beginning , but that’s because of the leather that needs to be broken down while in use . Other than that I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cristian

customer_reviews.title: Great while they last
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves but they don't last long. I workout 6 days a week. They only last about 3 months then they rip. I'm on my 3rd pair in about a year. This will be my last pair.
customer_reviews.author: SamBoudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Best lifting gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves for years. Most of the time the velcro wears out before anything else. Great comfort and durability. I am a person in the US not a Chinese poser.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Snug at first.
customer_reviews.text: Gloves were a little snug the first few times I wore them. Not as much velcro as my last pair either. Gloves fit great and are very comfortable now. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelley

customer_reviews.title: The right stuff
customer_reviews.text: I'm a serious weight lifter for 25 years and for the past 15 these are the only gloves I wear especially because they come in big sizes I have big hands but the gloves are made well and the price is right you won't be sorry by them and they're good looking
customer_reviews.author: bret knox

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT fit.
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT fit. Can't wait to get to the gym today to use them! Edited to add...using them daily now! These fit great and really help with grip as well as not tearing up my hands on weights. Also, these provide great wrist support
customer_reviews.author: tablet AT

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrist wraps for added wrist lifting strength
customer_reviews.text: I am a female who likes to keep nice soft hands but lift big ha! I DO wish that they went a little farther to cover middle finger bend as it slides down and I get calluses on them even with the gloves. Padding helps to lift more and not take a toll on your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie McLaurin

customer_reviews.title: The Grip!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best lifting gloves i have ever used. I used these in past than i thought i should try different ones but i was wrong. These gloves has well designed grip and they help me push more and more everyday with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Krunal

customer_reviews.title: Not what the used to be...or should be
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 10 year old harbinger gloves with these. What a difference! These are poorly made and not nearly as protective as the old ones. Most likely the result of a major and poorly planned cost reduction effort. I will be looking for new ones (not harbinger) for my next pair. I recommend you stay away from these.
customer_reviews.author: Charlesanna Ecker

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because my previous pair had worn out after over 2 years of almost daily use. I have only had these about a month and they are already starting to tear, plus I am getting calluses whereas I didn't with my previous leather Harbinger Pro Wristwrap Weightlifting Gloves. Not sure if I got a bad pair, but I am incredibly disappointed in these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S. Lowry

customer_reviews.title: The best workout gloves I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gym gloves. They do a very nice job protecting your hand and wrist. Also really durable I had one for over 2 years with 4 times a week weightlifting.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. It seems that the gloves are made with different material and the small is actually quite snug on me. I have noticed a black residue that comes off on my thumbs after a lifting session. It's happened every time I lift. Om hoping I can stretch the gloves out more and that this black residue will stop dirtying my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Biggie Smalls

customer_reviews.title: My daily work out gloves.
customer_reviews.text: The XXL is just a bit tight on my right hand . This is my second pair . I did buy the first pair at the gym . I do like the wrist support . I only do moderate weight at my age .
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Ripped Fast
customer_reviews.text: Glove ripped in less than a month of use. The entire upper palm to thumb padding area is completely exposed. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nancee B. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Not like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I had an older pair of these that lasted for years. Decided to get a new pair and not even a month into use and the right hand Velcro constantly comes undone which is rather annoying and unsafe during a workout. Looks like I'll be looking for another brand or back to wrist wraps.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL L

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in this last set
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this last set. This was maybe my 4th set of Harbinger gloves and normally I get new ones because the glove palms get worn out. This last set, however, the Velcro wore out and the gloves are just broken in. The stitching in some areas of the glove definitely isn't up to par. I like gloves with the wrist wrap but now i'm thinking of switching to other types without the wrist wrap to avoid this subpar velcro issue.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for years and usually get a 6 to 8 months. They are already falling apart after 2. Stitching is coming out all over.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Leather seam on thumb ruins them
customer_reviews.text: Leather seam on thumb is right on pressure point when doing curls. Felt a blister hot spot coming & had to switch back to my old gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Beardmore

customer_reviews.title: Can hold up to constant use
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for a long time in fact I need to buy a new set. It's to the point where they just are a little to much gym bag oder coming from them. I do use these gloves 5 to 6 nights a week and finally 1 finger is fraying a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie D. Cappama

customer_reviews.title: Buy this glove, you cannot go wrong, trust me!
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid 6-day a week weight-lifter for 35+ years and this has been my go-to glove for as long as I can remember. This glove is not only durable, it is also comfortable. You simply cannot go wrong by purchasing this glove!
customer_reviews.author: Rob_K

customer_reviews.title: Fits great but didnt last as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: Used them for the GYM couple of times a week - fit and feels great, but didnt last long before started to rip apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Dean

customer_reviews.title: The glove feels great on my hands and the wrist support really comes ...
customer_reviews.text: The glove feels great on my hands and the wrist support really comes in handy, but the threading for the Velcro started falling apart after I wore them for less than a month. (I work out 3 to 4 times a week). I was a bit disappointed because the quality of the materials used seem great and they're super comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this style of gloves for years. They last for about a year using them 2-3 times a week. The cuff usually starts to tear and it is time for a new set.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, not as sturdy as all-leather model
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find the mid-priced glove model I used previously any more-- the better ones are all quite a bit more. These are OK, and having more cloth may let them dry better and not get smelly as quickly. They probably won't last as long but that remains tbd.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of these gloves. They hold up well and recently I have been using a cane and they are good protection for the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane Hal

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Serve the purpose. Which they vented a bit more, and lasted a bit longer than 12 months, but protected the hands and wrists, and provide great grip. Run a bit small, so consider when sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work well!
customer_reviews.text: Been working out in the gym for about 8 months and on certain exercises I was having a lot of pain in my left wrist. Worked out yesterday with these and had the wrist supports nice and tight and had no wrist pain at all. They seem to be a quality made product and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R.

customer_reviews.title: Quality is well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Had these for several months now and lift several time a week. Well worth the price! Very little wear and support the wrist well. I blew through a pair of generic gloves in just a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: KU

customer_reviews.title: working out or working
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for working out. The padding helps when lifting. They are also great for working. I build cabinets and these gloves protect my hands from splinters while leaving my fingers open for handling screws and hardware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a present and the recipient loves them. They seem to be well constructed, and the wrist protection works very nice, especially for someone who has weak wrists to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: This one is holding up better than the first
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of harbinger gloves. This one is holding up better than the first, which lasted a solid 3 years of lifting. I like the built in wrist straps which is why I got this kind as opposed to others. They offer good support.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Smile

customer_reviews.title: Good glove
customer_reviews.text: Good glove but wrist strap is a bit short, barely makes it around to velcro. And i dont think my wrists are that big
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Good workout gloves
customer_reviews.text: Been using these same gloves for 10+ years, best ever. Seams will occasionally blow out at the fingers, or separate where the leather on the palm meets the stretch fabric, but overall, great strapped workout gloves for $20 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chong

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be but Ok
customer_reviews.text: As per other reviews not up to the old standard. Leather a little thin, fingers too short. Size guide off. I am L but had to return these and get XL. Not great but ok and I am keeping the XLs.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Using these for over a year now, and I'm talking 5 days a week. Great for beginners. Use them properly and you will get great use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Serial Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, real leather!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality glove. Real leather! A bit tight around the fingers (I bought XL size) but still feels like a quality glove. I'm hoping for a bit of stretch after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Feels good on the hands, fits well. But i i didnt like that my package was open when i got them in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: LankyRobTech

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Like the wrist wrap design. Gloves started off nice with good support and cushion but after about 10 wears they started to fall apart. My partner has the same pair and his are also falling apart. Frustrating as we purchased based on the reviews here. Looking for suggestions of gloves that are actually made well
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Cirino

customer_reviews.title: get a grip
customer_reviews.text: Gloves give good support to wrists and palms. Not difficult to put on. very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorimer

customer_reviews.title: Completely different size than expected from previous experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my husband because he loves the pair (same brand, same size) that he's worn out now. Unfortunately, the large size I ordered is so small that he can't even get more than his fingertips into the gloves! A huge disappointment, considering we live overseas and are unable to return them. They are unusable. Will not be ordering again, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grrrrre
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Solid gloves. Great wrist protection. It’s gonna take a while to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bad build quality. Would not recommend unless you plan to replace after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: As other have mentioned, the build quality is not very good at all. After a few months of use, the sticthing is coming apart on both gloves. At this rate they will probably last a couple of weeks before I'll have to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Pads In these tare really nice. Great quality. Better than others out there. Last pair lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: kellie

customer_reviews.title: wrong itm sent it has a long wriet wrap that ...
customer_reviews.text: wrong itm sent it has a long wriet wrap that is very bulky. the description never stated it it has wrist wrap, I already bought wriet wraps. Now you ar charging me $6.72 to return something that wasn't descripted in the summary.
customer_reviews.author: MARILYN

customer_reviews.title: Used to be my "go to" gloves
customer_reviews.text: These used to be my "go to" gloves. The quality has been lacking in the last couple pair that I've purchased. The durability has decreased significantly. I'll look elsewhere now.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dark

product_meta.title: Harbinger Pro Wristwrap Weightlifting Gloves with Vented Cushioned Leather Palm (Pair)
product_meta.description: Harbinger Pro WristWrap Weightlifting Gloves feature integrated wrist wraps that stabilize wrist joints with adjustable pressure for support when strength training. The genuine leather palm is vented to minimize sweat and is cushioned with resilient open-cell foam that maintains its structure and remains pliable. Wrap-around thumb protection covers the inside of the thumb with a second layer of leather to protect against abrasion, and the seams of the Harbinger Pro WristWrap Weightlifting Gloves are double-stitched for durability. 90 day manufacturer’s warranty. Hand wash and air dry only.
feature_bullets: Weightlifting gloves with integrated wrist wraps to stabilize wrist joints for support when lifting weights
Genuine leather palm is cushioned with resilient open-cell foam and vented to minimize sweat; seams are double-stitched for durability
1/2 finger-length increases contact for better grip
Wrap-around thumb protection covers the inside of the thumb with leather to protect against abrasion
90 day manufacturer's warranty; hand wash and air dry only
